item.title: 野村支持的加密货币公司 Komainu 以比特币融资 7500 万美元
item.description: 野村控股公司支持的加密货币托管公司 Komainu Holdings Ltd. 已从 Blockstream Capital Partners 募集到 7500 万美元。【原文：Komainu Holdings Ltd., a cryptocurrency custodian backed by Nomura Holdings Inc., has raised $75 million from Blockstream Capital Partners.】

item.title: 菲律宾计划采取更多措施避免大米价格飙升
item.description: 菲律宾表示正在采取更多措施降低大米价格，官员们说，尽管大幅削减关税、供应充足以及全球市场成本降低，但大米价格仍然居高不下。【原文：The Philippines said it’s taking more steps to lower rice prices, which officials said have remained high despite hefty tariff cuts, sufficient supply and lower costs in the global market.】

item.title: 印度实现 "历史性 "太空对接，未来任务的关键所在
item.description: 印度说，它已成功实施了首次太空对接实验，成为世界上仅有的第四个掌握了其他雄心勃勃的项目所需的关键技术的国家。【原文：India said it has successfully executed the first space docking experiment, becoming only the fourth country in the world to master a critical technology required for other ambitious projects.】

item.title: 政治风险犹存，投资者避开法国市场
item.description: 法国资产继续受到严重折价的困扰，总理弗朗索瓦-贝鲁（Francois Bayrou）试图解决目前的政治危机，但这远远不足以让投资者回心转意。他们的回归需要一个具体的计划来削减法国巨大的预算赤字。【原文：A heavy discount continues to plague French assets and Prime Minister Francois Bayrou’s attempt to tackle the ongoing political crisis has been far from enough to bring investors back. Their return requires a concrete plan to slash the country’s gaping budget deficit.】

item.title: 泰勒温比公司 2024 年英国住宅销售量接近预期最高水平
item.description: 泰勒温比公司（Taylor Wimpey Plc）表示，其 2024 年的房屋销售量接近先前指导目标的上限，这为英国房屋建筑商在经历了艰难的一年后提供了一些宽慰。【原文：Taylor Wimpey Plc said its home sales were toward the upper end of previous guidance in 2024, offering some relief after another tough year for UK housebuilders.】

item.title: 土耳其中央银行面临一万亿里拉流动性过剩问题
item.description: 由于土耳其中央银行加快了美元购买速度，本周土耳其金融系统中的过剩流动性增至创纪录的一万亿里拉（282 亿美元）。【原文：Excess liquidity in Turkey’s financial system swelled to a record one trillion lira ($28.2 billion) this week, as the central bank accelerated dollar purchases.】

item.title: 里夫斯预算案公布后首月英国经济增长令人失望
item.description: 英国经济在 11 月份勉强恢复增长，但低于预期，因为英国正努力摆脱人们对该国陷入滞胀的担忧。【原文：Britain’s economy narrowly returned to growth in November but fell short of expectations as the UK struggles to shake off concerns that the country is in the grip of stagflation.】

item.title: 假酒三天内在伊斯坦布尔造成 23 人死亡
item.description: 本周，土耳其最大的城市有 23 人死于饮用假酒，另有数十人伤势严重。【原文：Twenty-three people died in Turkey’s biggest city this week from consumption of counterfeit alcohol, with dozens more still in critical condition.】

item.description: 作为南非最大的建筑材料制造商，PPC 有限公司计划建造一座价值 30 亿兰特（1.6 亿美元）的水泥厂，为南非开普省提供服务，以实现其资产的现代化。【原文：PPC Ltd. plans to build a 3 billion-rand ($160 million) cement plant to serve South Africa’s Cape provinces as the nation’s top maker of the building material looks to modernize its assets.】

item.title: 据说 LG CNS 准备将首次公开募股定价定在市场范围的最高点
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，LG CNS 公司准备将其首次公开募股的价格定在市场定价范围的顶端，这将使该交易有望筹集到 1.2 万亿韩元（约合 8.23 亿美元）的资金，成为韩国三年来最大的上市交易。【原文：LG CNS Co. is poised to price its initial public offering at the top of its marketed range, people familiar with the matter said, putting the deal on course to raise 1.2 trillion won ($823 million) and become South Korea’s biggest listing in three years.】

item.title: 与特朗普和拜登关系密切的 TikTok 盟友竞相推迟对应用程序的禁令
item.description: 随着 TikTok 被禁的日子一天天临近，美国两大政党的政治家们都在想方设法让美国人继续使用这款中国人拥有的视频分享应用。【原文：With the ban on TikTok just days away, US politicians in both major parties are seeking ways to keep the Chinese-owned video-sharing app accessible for Americans.】

item.title: 欧洲复兴开发银行称今年可能在乌克兰投资 15 亿欧元
item.description: 欧洲复兴开发银行预计来年在乌克兰的投资将达到 15 亿欧元（15.4 亿美元），因为俄罗斯的持续入侵仍在对该国造成破坏。【原文：The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development sees its investments in Ukraine for the coming year at €1.5 billion ($1.54 billion) as Russia’s ongoing invasion continues to devastate the country.】

item.title: 普拉博沃领导的印尼在印尼盾面临风险的情况下推动经济加速增长
item.description: 在总统普拉博沃-苏比安托执政三个月后，印尼正不畏压力，用陷入困境的印尼盾来支撑该国不断放缓的经济，尽管分析人士警告说，这些政策举措可能会适得其反。【原文：Indonesia is defying pressure on the beleaguered rupiah to shore up the country’s slowing economy three months into President Prabowo Subianto’s administration, even as analysts warn the policy moves may backfire.】

item.title: 拜登的贸易主管警告特朗普不要依靠关税创收
item.description: 乔-拜登总统即将离任的贸易主管称，当选总统唐纳德-特朗普用关税收入取代所得税的想法 "非常、非常危险"，称这将伤害低收入工人。【原文：President Joe Biden’s departing trade chief called President-elect Donald Trump’s idea of using revenue from tariffs to replace income taxes “very, very dangerous,” saying it would hurt lower-earning workers.】

item.title: 波兰行长转向鹰派后将维持利率不变：决策指南
item.description: 在波兰央行行长出人意料地转向鹰派以及通胀率持续坚挺之后，波兰很可能在下一个月内不再降息。【原文：Poland is likely to refrain from cutting interest rates for another month after the central bank governor turned unexpectedly hawkish and inflation has remained sticky.】

item.title: 统计机构利用平安夜机票价格降低英国通胀率
item.description: 周三上午公布的 12 月份数据显示，通胀放缓似乎给英国经济带来了惊喜；但经济学家们注意到，一个不同寻常的节日原因可能会拖累数据。【原文：Slower inflation looked like a pleasant surprise for the British economy, when figures for December were published on Wednesday morning — but economists have noticed an unusually festive reason why the data may have been dragged down.】

item.title: 联盟银行第一大股东垂直主题据说考虑出售给星展集团
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，投资管理公司 Vertical Theme Sdn. 计划在未来几周内寻求批准，开始就出售其在马来西亚联盟银行有限公司（Alliance Bank Malaysia Bhd.【原文：Investment management firm Vertical Theme Sdn. is planning to seek approval in the coming weeks to start talks about selling its stake in Alliance Bank Malaysia Bhd., according to people familiar with the development.】

item.title: 万科债券大跌预示偿债担忧加剧
item.description: 长期以来被视为中国房地产市场风向标的中国万科集团股份有限公司正面临着日益加深的债券抛售，因为人们对该公司即将到期的巨额债务以及尽管政府努力救援但仍根深蒂固的房地产危机的担忧与日俱增。【原文：China Vanke Co., long considered a bellwether of the country’s property market, is facing a deepening bond selloff as worries grow about its mountain of debt coming due and a property crisis that remains entrenched despite government rescue efforts.】

item.title: 加沙协议影响运价，亚洲船舶库存下滑
item.description: 亚洲航运公司股价周四下跌，原因是市场预期以色列和哈马斯之间的停火协议将使红海航运正常化，从而使高涨的集装箱运费降温，并拖累利润。【原文：Shares of Asian shipping companies fell Thursday on expectations that a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas will normalize shipping in the Red Sea, cooling elevated container freight rates and weighing on profits.】

item.title: 央行注资后中国现金紧缩仍在继续
item.description: 由于中国政府注入的流动性未能抵消资金需求的飙升，中国的资金紧张局面继续扩大，交易出现了一些中断迹象。【原文：China’s cash squeeze extended with some signs of disruption to trading, as a liquidity infusion from Beijing failed to counteract a spike in demand for funds.】

item.title: 美国将腾讯支持的人工智能初创公司列入黑名单，科技限制进一步加深
item.description: 华盛顿将腾讯控股有限公司（Tencent Holdings Ltd.）支持的初创公司智普公司（Zhipu）列入贸易限制黑名单，将矛头对准了少数几家被认为是领先于 OpenAI 的 ChatGPT 的新兴公司之一。【原文：Washington has added Tencent Holdings Ltd.-backed startup Zhipu to a trade-restrictions blacklist, taking aim at one of a handful of fledgling firms considered frontrunners in the race to develop an answer to OpenAI’s ChatGPT.】

item.title: 继阿波罗之后，KKR 考虑加入 Seven & i 管理层收购计划
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，KKR & Co.正在考虑入股Seven & i Holdings Co.的创始家族提出的将这家日本便利店运营商私有化的提议，与同为私募股权巨头的阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.）一起参与创纪录的收购出价。【原文：KKR & Co. is considering taking a stake in a proposal by Seven & i Holdings Co.’s founding family to take the Japanese convenience store operator private, people familiar with the matter said, joining fellow private equity giant Apollo Global Management Inc. in the record buyout bid.】

item.title: 比亚迪希望以 2.16 万美元的电动汽车赢得韩国市场
item.description: 中国比亚迪股份有限公司将于今年在韩国推出三款电动乘用车，并将采取积极的定价策略，希望借此从传统本土品牌现代汽车公司和起亚公司手中赢得市场份额。【原文：China’s BYD Co. will launch three electric passenger cars in South Korea this year, with an aggressive pricing strategy that it hopes will win market share from legacy local brands Hyundai Motor Co. and Kia Corp.】

item.title: 在绿色电力供应蓬勃发展之后，中国正在加大电网支出
item.description: 在掀起史上最大规模的可再生能源热潮之后，中国现在正付出代价，以确保所有清洁能源都能进入家庭和企业。【原文：After launching the biggest boom in renewable power in history, China is now paying-up to make sure all that clean energy can get to homes and businesses.】

item.title: 特朗普、马斯克与微软首席执行官讨论人工智能和网络安全问题
item.description: 微软公司的萨蒂亚-纳德拉（Satya Nadella）在与美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）和埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）会面时讨论了人工智能和网络安全问题，成为向新政府示好的最新一位科技行业领袖。【原文：Microsoft Corp.’s Satya Nadella discussed AI and cybersecurity during a meeting with US President-elect Donald Trump and Elon Musk, becoming the latest tech industry chieftain to make overtures to the new administration.】
